intro: Oplismenopsis najada, commonly known as water starwort, is a small aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming in clusters at the base of the plant. Oplismenopsis najada plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
